title: International scenes
historical_context: This article serves as a revival of the 'International scenes' series, which last appeared in Phrack 48, highlighting the evolution of hacking cultures across different countries.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, security professionals, and those interested in hacker culture history.
short_summary: This article explores the hacking, cracking, and phreaking scenes in various countries, focusing on the evolution of these subcultures and their interconnectedness through the rise of the Internet. It includes contributions from different authors detailing the scenes in France, Quebec, and Brazil.
summary:
The article 'International scenes' provides a comprehensive overview of the global hacking landscape, emphasizing how the advent of chat systems and the Internet in the mid-1980s fostered a sense of community among hackers worldwide. It highlights the transformation of isolated hacking cultures into a unified subculture that transcends borders, driven by a shared goal of liberating information. The piece invites contributions from readers to further document and unite these diverse scenes, showcasing the rich tapestry of hacking history across different nations.

Focusing on specific regions, the article delves into the French underground scene, detailing its evolution from phreaking and hardware hacking in the pre-Internet era to the emergence of influential ezines and groups in the 1990s. It recounts the challenges faced by hackers due to government crackdowns and the infiltration of secret services. The Quebec scene is also explored, tracing its roots from early hacking groups to contemporary gatherings and conferences that continue to foster community engagement. Lastly, the Brazilian hacking scene is examined, from its nascent days in the BBS era to the rise of script-kiddies and the eventual maturation of the community with conferences and active ezines. Overall, the article serves as a vital historical document, capturing the essence of hacking cultures and their ongoing evolution.
